result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan C Simonsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work or AODA treatment.
Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program.  Probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge  are to be paid by 8/11/2016.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State of Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No contact with Paul N.
Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence.
Successfuly complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification course.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine sreens.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  STAYED: to be used by the agent and the Court.

records.addlTxt: Order Denying Request for Expungement, received and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag
Letter from Attorney John Hawley Requesting case to be Expunged.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Defendant 's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 38 days, Huber privileges for work or AODA treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.   Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-30 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME, IMPOSED and STAYED to be used by the agent and the Court
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with Paul N.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/11/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/11/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
**Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon succesful completion of the sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also she may not vote in any election until hher civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
